description: Enterprise techniques used by Stealth Falcon, ATT&CK group G0038 v1.0
name: Stealth Falcon (G0038)

techniques.techniqueName: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
techniques.comment: After data is collected by [Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware, it is exfiltrated over the existing C2 channel.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers data from the local victim system.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware uses PowerShell and WMI to script data collection and command execution on the victim.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers a list of running processes.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers passwords from multiple sources, including Windows Credential Vault, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, and Outlook.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware communicates with its C2 server via HTTPS.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware creates a scheduled task entitled “IE Web Cache” to execute a malicious file hourly.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) table from the victim.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers the registered user and primary owner name via WMI.

[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers system information via WMI, including the system directory, build number, serial number, version, manufacturer, model, and total physical memory.

[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware uses PowerShell commands to perform various functions, including gathering system information via WMI and executing commands from its C2 server.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware gathers system information via Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware attempts to determine the installed version of .NET by querying the Registry.
[Stealth Falcon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0038) malware encrypts C2 traffic using RC4 with a hard-coded key.
